text: <@U0TH372DT> open issue still? <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/45419>

Hi,
Is there a way to change `logging driver` of containers in the pods to `fluentd`?
I read that kubernetes does not support this: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/15478>

I know i can change the logging driver on the host docker daemon, but `fluentd` itself would be running as a pod, would such configuration work?
I'm assuming based on <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/28610> that it doesn't do anything smart currently
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/14188>
add <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/8830> to 2018 goals
Some earlier discussion wrt this - <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/48938>
Also, given that ATM runtimes in general can’t update cgroups of running containers, see <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/5774> that means that we’ll always create a new pod, for now
you can subscribe to: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/48180> to see when and if will ever be in
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/53533>
Anyways, <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/5774> says it all …
<@U0Q3RNQBC> Yes, we do have some limitations with services. There's an issue discussing it - <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/48938>
points <@U6UB5V4TX|tpepper> to <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36858>
<@U762JN8RG> i think sig-apps would be faster to get response on this, but may be this issue is related: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/42649>

> Has anyone tested how many services are supported with the IPVS base in-cluster service load balancing added for 1.8

<@U34FY5S2W> Not that I know of. It might be worth checking with sig-network once. Also see- <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/48938>
<@U7EJ5USD6> there is an open ticket for supporting user-defined deployment strategies, though it hasn’t seen any activity since April. <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/14510>
not sure who to ping to help on <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/53221>, but I can help (after christmas break :stuck_out_tongue:)

Hi,
Is there a way to change `logging driver` of containers in the pods to `fluentd`?
I read that kubernetes does not support this: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/15478>

I know i can change the logging driver on the host docker daemon, but `fluentd` itself would be running as a pod, would such configuration work?
I want to work on this issue <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/47668>
I haven't checked in a while, but <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/26093>
hi there! I'm looking at an issue for the node e2e tests, is that still of interest to you? <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/46310>
Opened the ticket <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/53533> please revisit decision on failing when swap is enabled
<https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/35062>

This thread <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/48938> makes it sound like  `iptables-save | grep -E '^-A KUBE-SERVICES' | wc -l` is the factor you care about, being less than 10k? And that in my context you’d want `n` number of nodes times `p` number of ports in the NodePort service to be less than 10k, i.e. `n*p < 10k`.  Or do you only care about `p < 10k` and not about `n` in this case?
<@U0LK5J4NQ> I've filled <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/57660> for this
